fusetools.cloud_tools.AWS¶

class fusetools.cloud_tools.AWS[source]¶

Bases: object

Functions for interacting with AWS infrastructure, including: S3, Redshift, DynamoDB

Methods

create_s3_bucket

delete_dynamo_tbl

Deletes a DynamoDB table.

delete_s3_object

Deletes a list of S3 bucket objects.

df_to_s3

Sends a Pandas DataFrame to S3.

dynamo_to_redshift

Copies contents of a DynamoDB table to a Redshift table.

file_to_s3

Uploads a local file to an S3 bucket.

get_dynamo_fields

Retrieves a list of fields for a given DynamoDB table.

load_dynamo

Inserts either a Dictionary or Pandas DataFrame into DynamoDB.

make_dynamo_tbl

Creates a Dynamo table.

query_dynamo

Downloads data from a DynamoDB table into a Pandas DataFrame.

rs_to_s3

Transfers a Redshift query result to a data object on S3.

s3_list_files

Returns a list of objects in an S3 bucket.

s3_to_df

Saves data from S3 to a Pandas DataFrame.

s3_to_file

Saves an S3 object to a local filepath.

s3_to_rs

Transfers an S3 data object into a Redshift relational database table.

s3_to_s3

Transfers an S3 data object to another S3 bucket.
classmethod delete_dynamo_tbl(pub, sec, region_name, tbl_name)[source]¶

Deletes a DynamoDB table.

Parameters

  • pub – AWS account public key.

  • sec – AWS account secret key.

  • region_name – Region name where the Dynamo table is.

  • tbl_name – Name of Dynamo table.

Returns

JSON response for API call.

classmethod delete_s3_object(pub, sec, bucket, obj_list)[source]¶

Deletes a list of S3 bucket objects.

Parameters

  • pub – AWS account public key.

  • sec – AWS account secret key.

  • bucket – S3 bucket name.

  • obj_list – List of bucket objects to be deleted, in the following format: [{“Key”: “your_file_name_key”}].

Returns

JSON response for API call.

classmethod df_to_s3(df, object_name, bucket, pub, sec, sep, header=False)[source]¶

Sends a Pandas DataFrame to S3.

Parameters

  • df – Pandas DataFrame.

  • object_name – S3 bucket object name to save DataFrame to.

  • bucket – S3 bucket name.

  • pub – AWS account public key.

  • sec – AWS account secret key.

  • sep – Delimiter for Pandas DataFrame.

  • header – Indicates if Pandas DataFrame should be sent with a header.

Returns

JSON response for API call.

classmethod dynamo_to_redshift(cursor, pub, sec, tbl_name_rs, tbl_name_dynamo, readratio=50, fields=False)[source]¶

Copies contents of a DynamoDB table to a Redshift table.

Parameters

  • cursor – Redshift database cursor object.

  • pub – AWS account public key.

  • sec – AWS account secret key.

  • tbl_name_rs – Name of Redshift table.

  • tbl_name_dynamo – Name of Dynamo table.

  • readratio – The percentage of the DynamoDB table’s provisioned throughput to use for the data load

  • fields – List of fields to pull from Dynamo table.

Returns

Completed Dynamo to Redshift ETL operation.

classmethod file_to_s3(folder_file, bucket, object_name, pub, sec, metadata_d=False, public_file=False)[source]¶

Uploads a local file to an S3 bucket.

Parameters

  • folder_file – Filepath of local file.

  • bucket – Name of S3 bucket.

  • object_name – Bucket path of S3 object to upload to.

  • pub – AWS account public key.

  • sec – AWS account secret key.

  • metadata_d – Dictionary of metadata to add to uploaded S3 bucket object.

  • public_file – Switch to make S3 bucket object open to public access.

Returns

Log of data object transfer (from filepath to bucket object).

classmethod get_dynamo_fields(tbl_name, pub, sec, region_name)[source]¶

Retrieves a list of fields for a given DynamoDB table.

Parameters

  • tbl_name – Name of Dynamo table.

  • pub – AWS account public key.

  • sec – AWS account secret key.

  • region_name – Region name where the Dynamo table is.

Returns

JSON response for API call.

classmethod load_dynamo(pub, sec, region_name, tbl_name, d)[source]¶

Inserts either a Dictionary or Pandas DataFrame into DynamoDB.

Parameters

  • pub – AWS account public key.

  • sec – AWS account secret key.

  • region_name – Region name for DynamoDB table.

  • tbl_name – Name of DynamoDB table.

  • d – Dictionary or Pandas DataFrame to be loaded.

Returns

JSON response for API call.

classmethod make_dynamo_tbl(pub, sec, region_name, tbl_name, key_schema, attribute_definitions, provisioned_throughput)[source]¶

Creates a Dynamo table.

Parameters

  • pub – AWS account public key.

  • sec – AWS account secret key.

  • region_name – Region name where the Dynamo table is.

  • tbl_name – Name of Dynamo table.

  • key_schema – List of table key objects containing attribute names and key types.

  • attribute_definitions – List of attribute definition objects for the keys, including attribute names and data types.

  • provisioned_throughput – Read & Write capacity for table.

Returns

JSON response for API call.

classmethod query_dynamo(pub, sec, region_name, tbl_name, data_format='list', fields=False)[source]¶

Downloads data from a DynamoDB table into a Pandas DataFrame.

Parameters

  • pub – AWS account public key.

  • sec – AWS account secret key.

  • region_name – Region name for DynamoDB table.

  • tbl_name – Name of DynamoDB table.

  • data_format – Specifies type of data structure to return, it not ‘list’ returns a Pandas DataFrame.

  • fields – DynamoDB table fields to pull data from.

Returns

Pandas DataFrame of DynamoDB data.

classmethod rs_to_s3(cursor, sql, bucket_path, delimiter, pub, sec, exec=True)[source]¶

Transfers a Redshift query result to a data object on S3.

Parameters

  • cursor – Redshift cursor object.

  • sql – Redshift query’s SQL statement.

  • bucket_path – Bucket path of S3 data object to save data to.

  • delimiter – Delimiter for S3 data object when converted from Redshift query result.

  • pub – AWS account public key.

  • sec – AWS account secret key.

  • exec – Specifies whether to execute the command if True or return the command’s text if false.

Returns

Log of data object transfer (from query to bucket object).

classmethod s3_list_files(bucket, pub, sec, search_str=False)[source]¶

Returns a list of objects in an S3 bucket.

Parameters

  • bucket – Name of S3 bucket.

  • pub – AWS account public key.

  • sec – AWS account secret key.

  • search_str – Search string to limit results by.

Returns

Dictionary of bucket object file names, creation times and metadata.

classmethod s3_to_df(object_name, bucket, pub, sec, sep, header=False)[source]¶

Saves data from S3 to a Pandas DataFrame.

Parameters

  • object_name – S3 data object to save to Pandas.

  • bucket – S3 Bucket name.

  • pub – AWS account public key.

  • sec – AWS account secret key.

  • sep – Delimiter for S3 data object to convert to a DataFrame.

  • header – Indicates if the S3 data object contains a header to use for the DataFrame.

Returns

Pandas DataFrame of S3 data object.

classmethod s3_to_file(bucket, object_name, folder_file, pub, sec)[source]¶

Saves an S3 object to a local filepath.

Parameters

  • bucket – Name of S3 bucket.

  • object_name – Bucket path of S3 object to save.

  • folder_file – Name of local filepath.

  • pub – AWS account public key.

  • sec – AWS account secret key.

Returns

Log of data object transfer (from bucket object to filepath).

classmethod s3_to_rs(cursor, tbl_name, bucket_path, pub, sec, delimiter, updates_off=False, exec=True)[source]¶

Transfers an S3 data object into a Redshift relational database table.

Parameters

  • cursor – Redshift cursor object.

  • tbl_name – Redshift table name.

  • bucket_path – Bucket path of S3 data object to copy.

  • pub – AWS account public key.

  • sec – AWS account secret key.

  • delimiter – Delimiter for S3 data object to convert to a Redshift table.

  • updates_off – Redshift Insert/Upsert performance tuning parameter.

  • exec – Specifies whether to execute the command if True or return the command’s text if false.

Returns

Log of data object transfer (from bucket object to table).

classmethod s3_to_s3(pub, sec, bucket_from, bucket_to, from_key, to_key)[source]¶

Transfers an S3 data object to another S3 bucket.

Parameters

  • pub – AWS account public key.

  • sec – AWS account secret key.

  • bucket_from – S3 bucket to transfer object from.

  • bucket_to – S3 bucket to transfer object to.

  • from_key – Path of S3 data object to transfer.

  • to_key – Destination path of transferred S3 data object.

Returns

JSON response for API call.
